title: Friday's Moves Consolidated Weekly Gains
text:
There wasn't a whole lot to say about Friday's trading. The solid move made over the course of the week across indices was maintained with either small losses or doji. Part of this is because indices are now approaching multi-year highs which will see increased resistance.

The posted a small doji as technicals remained net bullish.

SPX Daily Chart

The posted a small loss which was enough to stall a net bullish turn in technicals. However, another one day gain would probably be enough to reverse the 'sell' trigger in On-Balance-Volume and turn technicals net bullish.

COMPQ Daily Chart

While the NASDAQ experienced a small loss, the looks to keep control of bullish momentum with it only finishing on a doji.

SOX Daily Chart

The also took a small loss. Key for this index will be for it to hold the consolidation breakout; it does have a long way to go to make up lost ground on other indices.

RUT Daily Chart

The relationship between and had consolidated for most of 2018 and 2019, but this relationship is in the process of breaking down, which would be bearish for the market.

XLY/XLP Monthly Chart

Likewise the relationship between the Indices and has accelerated lower, which is another tick in the bear market column

TRAN/INDU Weekly Chart

Monday will be about pushing the advantage of last week in the indices and improving the secular picture, which is edging in favor of bears.
description: Stocks Analysis by Declan Fallon covering: S&P 500, Dow Jones Industrial Average, US SmallCap 2000, NASDAQ Composite. Read Declan Fallon's latest article on Investing.com
